intro: Deringa dissecta, commonly known as the dissected dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features finely dissected leaves that form a rosette at the base, with a hairy stem that supports its yellowish flower heads. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, typical of the genus Taraxacum. Deringa dissecta is often found in grassy areas and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
